Lorena A. Ramírez-López

Full stack web developer with extensive background in film and television. Trained as a Moving Image Preservation Specialist for digital and Time-Based Media artworks. Focus on coding to develop tools and technologies that expand information and access of media and art to new sectors and communities.

    Webrecorder

    • Work for: webrecorder
    • Since: Nov 2020 - Present
    • Position: Community Manager

    Webrecorder provides a suite of open source projects and tools to capture interactive websites and replay them at a later time as accurately as possible. I manage and edit the community calls as well as work on technical documentation and instructions on all tools.

    Myriad Consulting

    • Work for: Myriad Consulting
    • Since: Jan 2020 - Present
    • Position: Consultant

    My areas of consultation include strategic planning for collection management, digitization, and preservation policy development and process improvement; Audiovisual preservation and reformatting projects; Documentation and training; Collections moves and change management; Digital Preservation; Tools and Technologies for Digital Asset Management and Access; Digital preservation systems and implementation, time-based media preservation.

    Web Developer

    • Work for: You can contract me for projects!
    • Since: Sept 2020 - Present
    • Position: Full Stack Web Developer

    I went to the Flatiron program for full stack web development, and have been contracted for developing WordPress sites, configuring servers, documenting PHP projects, digital asset management, and more. I'm a quick learner and will explain and document the technical stuff so you can better understand your product too!

    Circletime

    • Work for: Circletime
    • Since: Sept 2020 - Present
    • Position: Senior Producer

    Circletime is pioneering children’s live online learning. We have intentionally designed our platform and classes to match the developmental and academic needs of children 0-10 years old. As a producer, I livestream via Zoom and faciliate instructors with lighting, framing, and cameras.

    Fluent City

    • Work for: Fluent City
    • Since: Nov 2018 - Present
    • Position: Spanish Teacher

    I received my Bachelors of Arts in Spanish from the College of Arts and Sciences in New York University. I teach basic Spanish through film, art, and media.

    Av Specialist

    • Work for: You can contract me for projects!
    • Since: Sept 2015 - Present
    • Position: Moving Image Preservation Specialist

    I studied and trained at the Moving Image Archiving and Preservation program at NYU. I've consulted with archives, museums, communities, and organizations on their audiovisual collections, with a specialized skill in digital collections.

    Amia

    • Organization: Association of Moving Image Archivists
    • Member since: 2013 - Present
    • Position: International Outreach Co-Chair

    Advocate of open-source and outreach within the audiovisual archiving community.

    Aic

    • Organization: American Institute of Conservation
    • Member since: 2020 - Present
    • Position: EMG Secretary/Treasurer

    Part of the Electronic Media Group (EMG), a specialty group in AIC that supports the work of conservators, artists, archivists, curators, registrars, collection managers, and other technical specialists in the conservation of artworks and other works of cultural heritage that employ historic or emerging audiovisual media, digital media, and electric or electronic technologies. As of 2021, I was elected as Secretary/Treasurer for EMG and will begin my 2-year term next year.

    Xfr Collective

    • Organization: XFR Collective
    • Member since: 2013 - Present
    • Position: Active Member

    XFR Collective partners with artists, activists, and community organizations to lower the barriers to preserving at-risk audiovisual media – especially unseen, unheard, or marginalized works – through digitization, screenings, educational workshops, and pop-up events. Operating through a non-hierarchical model, we work to create an inclusive environment in which to explore practical methods for media preservation, archiving, and access.

    Nyu Bachelors Of Arts Class Of 2012

    • Education: College of Arts and Sciences ~ TISCH School of the Arts
    • Date: Sept 2008 - May 2012
    • Studied: Spanish and Cinema Studies

    I doubled majored in undergrad in Cinema Studies from TISCH School of the Arts and the Spanish Honors Program from the Department of Spanish and Portuguese Languages and Literatures from College of Arts and Sciences. I defended and received honors for my investigation on Paraguayan cinema and defended my thesis, "Ne Hendu Kiriri - Listening to Silence in Four Recent Paraguayan Films".
